intro: Araiostegia perdurans, commonly known as the everlasting flower, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its long-lasting, showy inflorescences that remain intact for extended periods, giving it its common name. Native to South America, particularly Brazil, this plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant has simple, ovate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white. Its botanical features make it a popular subject in botanical gardens and horticultural studies.
